    • Method Detail

      • scale

        public Scale scale()
        Description copied from interface: Image
        Returns the pixel-scale of this image. This will be Scale.ONE unless HiDPI images are being used.

      • ensureTexture

        public int ensureTexture()
        Description copied from interface: Image
        Creates a texture for this image (if one does not already exist) and returns its OpenGL texture id. Returns 0 if the underlying image data is not yet ready or if this platform does not use OpenGL. The texture will remain in GPU memory until Image.clearTexture() is called or this image is garbage collected.

        Note: this texture handle should not be held for longer than the scope of the enclosing function call. It is not safe to hang onto an image's texture handle as the image may delete its texture and recreate it under any number of circumstances.

      • clearTexture

        public void clearTexture()
        Description copied from interface: Image
        Clears the GPU texture associated with this image, on platforms implemented via OpenGL. Does nothing on non-OpenGL platforms. In general it is not necessary to call this method. Images added to ImageLayer instances automatically clear their texture when the image layer is removed from the scene graph. Textures are also cleared when the image is garbage collected. However, if you manually call Image.ensureTexture(), or if you draw images to a Surface, you may wish to clear textures manually to avoid running out of GPU memory before garbage collection has a chance to run and clear the textures for you.
